html.problem:
CheckPoint: Angular Momentum of a rod
from __future__ import division from loncapa import *
a=lc_random(1,3,1) b=lc_random(1,3,1) c=lc_random(1,3,1) m=lc_choose(a,0.1,1.2,3.0) l=lc_choose(b,0.8,1.2,1.8) i=7* m* l* l/48 o=lc_choose(c,12,30,96) L = i* o*2*3.14/60
A uniform rod of mass m = $m kg and length l = $l m is pivoted as shown. The rod is at rest and then released. The acceleration due to gravity is g = 9.8 m/ \(s^{2}\).
.
Part 1. Find the rotational inertia of the rod relative to the axis passing through the pivot point (shown as a dashed line in the diagram).
\(I\) [kg.m2] =
Part 2. Find the angular momentum of the rod if it is spinning around that axis at a constant angular speed \(\omega\) = $o RPM (rounds per minute).
\(L\)[kg.m2.s-1] =
